medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's wife noted occasional episodes of confusion and disorientation over the previous 5 years. During the last 2 months, there was a change in behavior with more frequent episodes of disorientation and progressive memory impairment. Nine days before admission, the patient was incoherent during a telephone interview. Four days prior, his physician observed difficulty in understanding conversations. After experiencing a seizure at 3 a.m., he became disoriented and unable to follow commands.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent malignant melanoma of the right conjunctiva and eyelid, head trauma with extradural hematoma in infancy, emphysema, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, depression, and hepatitis C virus infection with a serum HCV RNA level of 1.6 million IU/mL one month prior to admission. Previous surgeries included left frontoparietal craniotomy and bilateral lens implantations.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of kidney cancer, mother died of colon cancer, one brother died of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, another brother died in a motor vehicle accident at age 15. No known family history of neurologic disease.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lived with his wife and had one adult daughter. He smoked cigarettes and drank alcohol socially. History of substance abuse includes alcohol, cocaine, amphetamines, LSD, marijuana, and intravenous heroin; however, he had not used illicit drugs in at least 10 years. Occupational exposure to organic solvents in industrial degreasers.
